Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Smooch \Smooch\, v. t. See {Smutch}. [1913 Webster] [1913 Webster] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Smutch \Smutch\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Smutched}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Smutching}.] To blacken with smoke, soot, or coal. [Written also {smooch}.] --B. Jonson. [1913 Webster]
smooch n : an enthusiastic kiss [syn: {smack}] v : snuggle and lie in a position where one person faces the back of the others [syn: {snog}, {spoon}]
